text:
Lebeziatnikov looked worried. 

“I’ve come to you, Sofya Semyonovna,” he said. 

Sonia screamed. 

“Katerina Ivanovna has gone out of her mind!” 

Lebeziatnikov continued, “She’s making the children sing and dance. They beg in the street.” 

Sonia grabbed her cloak and hat. 

“I must go!” she said, rushing out. 

Raskolnikov followed her. 

“She's certainly mad!” Lebeziatnikov exclaimed. 

“Did you mention tubercles?” Raskolnikov asked. 

“Not exactly. She wouldn’t understand,” he replied. 

“What if you convince her logically?” 

“Life would be too easy if it were so,” Raskolnikov said.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Katerina Ivanovna is exhibiting signs of madness, causing distress among those around her.
